listing.description: Offers in Excess of £600,000planning approved ... Providing an excellent and unique opportunity to convert a former Barn/Workshop into a detached four bedroom character property, with period features. The design encapsulates both the character of the original buildings and a contemporary flair, ideal for modern day living and entertaining.Located within the grounds (which will be separated), of a former Manor House. The home will sit within wonderful surroundings, incorporating a recently restored Victorian Gllasshouse, pond and wonderful grounds.The home has been designed to incorporate four bedrooms, including a glazed link, under a traditional slate roof with an oak framed and glazed entrance. To the ground floor there will be, via an extension, an inviting and highly appointed kitchen/breakfast room and living room with two feature sunken patio areas. Also to the ground floor there will be a shower/cloakroom, separate utility and two bedrooms. The master bedroom uniquely has a private internal staircase to the first floor where there is provision for a large dressing room and ensuite bathroom.To the first floor there will be two further double bedrooms and a centrally located family bathroom.To the exterior, the gardens which are mature and as stated include a beautifully restored Victorian Glasshouse, together with swathes of landscaped borders and lawned areas.A detached garage and bike store has also been applied for which together with the vast parking area, will providing parking for several vehicles.It is rare that properties with this opportunity in such a tranquil and architecturally joyous setting are available and we therefore recommend arranging an early viewing to avoid disappointment.

It’s also ideal for people struggling to find time to plan and manage their projects, as you can still achieve the home you want but with a vastly reduced time commitment.Here are some key questions to consider when deciding whether a turnkey design and build solution is right for you:Do you want to be hands on? listing.letting_fees:
Guide to our fees:

1. In order to secure a Property we require to take upfront admin fees of £72 inclusive of VAT per tenant for referencing which includes a credit check, plus £180 inclusive of VAT for the administration. These fees are non refundable should you not proceed with the tenancy or if your references are not satisfactory. P.A Jones reserves the right to take a higher holding fee for larger Properties or for holding Properties for more than 1 month – to be agreed at offer stage. The Agency reserves the right to request a higher holding fee of up to one months rent if the property is held unavailable for over a month to be agreed at the point of reservation. Rent excludes the Tenancy Deposit and any other fees or charges which maybe payable.

2. Due to compliance with current money laundering regulations two forms of I.D. Must be shown prior to a full credit check & referencing being completed, which requires details of your current address, employment details (or your accountants contact details if you are self-employed), your current Landlord or Letting Agent details (if relevant), bank details & information regarding any county court judgements, rent arrears or adverse credit history. A character reference may also be required. The I.D must be one of the following: Current signed passport, identity card, current photo driving licence or armed forces id card/Police warrant card and one of the following: A recent utility bill or bank statement (not a mobile phone bill), council tax demand/statement, house or motor insurance certificate or paper part of current driving licence (dated within the last 3 months).

3. Once satisfactory references have been obtained you will be required to pay a security deposit (of 1 & ½ months rent) plus the first months rent in advance (the holding fee of £200 per tenant will be deducted from this balance). This payment must be made in cleared funds i.E. Bank Draft, Building Society Cheque, Cash (if under £1000.00) or by debit or credit card. Personal cheques will not be accepted as payment.

4. All tenants wishing to occupy the property must come to the office to sign the tenancy
agreement on or before the tenancy start date. If a guarantor is required, the guarantor must also come to the office to sign a legal undertaking before the tenancy agreement is signed.

5. On or before the day you move in, it is the tenants responsibility to contact all the relevant utilities e.G. B.T., gas & electricity suppliers, water boards and the local Council Tax department to provide relevant readings & to transfer the accounts into your name/s.

6. Upon renewal or extension of this tenancy an administration fee of £50 +vat (£60.00) is payable for the preparation of any documents. Should you require a reference from the agent the cost is £20 +vat (£24.00) per tenant. If an addendum to contract is required during the tenancy an administration fee of £50 +vat (£60.00) will apply. Should you require the agent to visit the property for access due to loss of keys a charge of £20 +vat (£24.00) will be made. Any tenancy documents that you require for us to re-print and send to you (i.E. Tenancy agreements, inventories) will be charged for at £15 +vat (£18.00). If rental payments (made to us by card) are taken late on a regular basis an additional fee of £5.00 will be added to the payment. Charges also apply for the check-out procedure at the end of the tenancy (relative to the property size and contents). Unpaid charges or fees will be deducted from the security deposit at the end of the Tenancy.

7. Early release from the tenancy agreement will incur additional charges.

listing.description: An exciting opportunity to acquire a building plot with the benefit of approved planning permission (subject to conditions) for the erection of a substantial detached house approximately 4200 sq ft (390 sq m) on an exceptionally generous plot totalling 1.21 acres, and with far reaching views across the surrounding countryside.The site occupies a frontage of 176 ft (54m) to Pean Hill, and an overall depth of 345 ft (105m) and is ideally positioned for access to the vibrant seaside town of Whitstable (2.6 miles distant) and Canterbury (4.2 miles distant).The proposed accommodation is largely open-plan and arranged over three floors, comprising an entrance lobby, family room, living/dining room open-plan to kitchen, utility room, study, gymnasium, four double bedrooms and three bathrooms, including a luxurious master bedroom suite. The house has been sympathetically designed to complement it's surroundings, whilst achieving a modern aesthetic with the use of contemporary materials including muted red brick, neutral render, treated timber and zinc, and a slate roof. A generous driveway will provide off road parking for a number of vehicles.Further information is available on the Canterbury City Council website;  under reference ca//17/00246.LocationPean Hill is a conveniently situated between Whitstable and Canterbury and lies within close proximity to the village of Blean with its range of local shops, public house and popular primary school.Whitstable (2.5 miles distant) is a popular seaside town renowned for it's charming seafront and working harbour and enjoys a bustling town centre providing an array of boutique shops and highly regarded restaurants. The Cathedral City of Canterbury (3.6 miles distant) offers a popular theatre, a wealth of cultural and leisure amenities and benefits from excellent public and state schools. The City also boasts the facilities of a major shopping centre enjoying a range of mainstream retail outlets as well as many individual and designer shops. The High Speed Rail Link (Javelin Service) from Canterbury West provides frequent services to London St Pancras with a journey time of approximately 54 minutes. The A299 is also easily accessible offering access to the A2/M2 leading to the channel ports and subsequent motorway network.

The proposed accommodation is largely open-plan and arranged over three floors, comprising an entrance lobby, family room, living/dining room open-plan to kitchen, utility room, study, gymnasium, four double bedrooms and three bathrooms, including a luxurious master bedroom suite. The house has been sympathetically designed to complement it's surroundings, whilst achieving a modern aesthetic with the use of contemporary materials including muted red brick, neutral render, treated timber and zinc, and a slate roof. A generous driveway will provide off road parking for a number of vehicles. Further information is available on the Canterbury City Council website; under reference ca//17/00246.

Location

Pean Hill is a conveniently situated between Whitstable and Canterbury and lies within close proximity to the village of Blean with its range of local shops, public house and popular primary school. Whitstable (2.5 miles distant) is a popular seaside town renowned for it's charming seafront and working harbour and enjoys a bustling town centre providing an array of boutique shops and highly regarded restaurants. The Cathedral City of Canterbury (3.6 miles distant) offers a popular theatre, a wealth of cultural and leisure amenities and benefits from excellent public and state schools. The City also boasts the facilities of a major shopping centre enjoying a range of mainstream retail outlets as well as many individual and designer shops. The High Speed Rail Link (Javelin Service) from Canterbury West provides frequent services to London St Pancras with a journey time of approximately 54 minutes. The A299 is also easily accessible offering access to the A2/M2 leading to the channel ports and subsequent motorway network.

The popular seaside town of Whitstable is situated on the stunning North Kent coast, 7 miles north of the historical city of Canterbury and less than 60 miles from central London. With its quaint alley ways, colourful high street and peaceful shingle beaches this town has a lot to offer both residents and holiday makers. Famous for its working harbour and oysters; which have been collected in the area since Roman times and celebrated at the annual July Whitstable Oyster Festival. For entertainment there are excellent water sport facilities, plenty of art galleries, and a wealth of independently run restaurants, boutiques and cafes to enjoy along the vibrant high street. The Crab and Winkle Way, one of the earliest passenger railways and the first ever steam-powered railway in the world, follows the disused railway line between Canterbury and Whitstable, and is now a popular walking and cycle route through woods and countryside. Road links via the A299 Thanet Way give easy access to the M2 for travel to London and beyond. Whitstable also has a main line train station providing fast and frequent links into London Victoria (1hr 30 mins) and London St Pancras (1hr 11mins).

listing.description: **chain free**Offered to the market for the first time in 50 years! This fabulous potential re-development site (subject to planning permission) is set in the highly desirable village of Chartham Hatch. This fantastic plot measures approximately 0.45 of an acre tbv and currently houses a five bedroom detached house in need of total modernisation throughout. Alternatively, it could lend itself to a complete replacement of potentially more than one property, depending on your preferences. Previous planning for a second dwelling within the grounds was granted but has now expired. The village itself is just 5 miles from Canterbury city centre and offers a good bus service.This is a great opportunity for developers of all sizes with scope for many different options based on your own requirements.Surrounding areasThe property is situated within 5 miles of Canterbury, being within easy access of the High Street and all its amenities. These include an excellent modern shopping centre, the University of Kent, Canterbury Christ Church University and other colleges, together with an excellent choice of schools in both the public and private sectors. In addition to the High Street is the Kings Mile, which is a lovely mall of boutique style shops, cafes, eateries and public houses.Sport and local amenitiesSporting and recreational opportunities nearby include: Golf at Scotland Hills, Canterbury, sailing at Whitstable Yacht Club and Herne Bay, county cricket at Canterbury and day trips to France via Eurotunnel, all within easy access. **chain free** Offered to the market for the first time in 50 years! This fabulous potential re-development site (subject to planning permission) is set in the highly desirable village of Chartham Hatch. This fantastic plot measures approximately 0.45 of an acre tbv and currently houses a five bedroom detached house in need of total modernisation throughout. Alternatively, it could lend itself to a complete replacement of potentially more than one property, depending on your preferences. Previous planning for a second dwelling within the grounds was granted but has now expired. The village itself is just 5 miles from Canterbury city centre and offers a good bus service. This is a great opportunity for developers of all sizes with scope for many different options based on your own requirements.

Surrounding areas The property is situated within 5 miles of Canterbury, being within easy access of the High Street and all its amenities. These include an excellent modern shopping centre, the University of Kent, Canterbury Christ Church University and other colleges, together with an excellent choice of schools in both the public and private sectors. In addition to the High Street is the Kings Mile, which is a lovely mall of boutique style shops, cafes, eateries and public houses. Sport and local amenities Sporting and recreational opportunities nearby include: Golf at Scotland Hills, Canterbury, sailing at Whitstable Yacht Club and Herne Bay, county cricket at Canterbury and day trips to France via Eurotunnel, all within easy access. In addition, the recently refurbished Marlowe Theatre, the spectacular Beaney House of Art & Knowledge and the Gulbenkian (theatre, cinema and café bar) at the University of Kent, all provide a wealth of excellent entertainment in Canterbury. Communications Canterbury has two mainline railway stations, with Canterbury West offering the high speed service to London (St Pancras 56 mins). The property is also within easy access of the A2 dual carriageway, which in turn links to the Channel Port of Dover and Brenley Corner at Faversham, adjoining the M2 / A299 (Thanet Way) linking London and the coastal towns respectively. Ashford International (15.4 miles, London St Pancras 38 mins) which also has services to the continent via Eurostar (Paris 1 hr 52 mins) or via Eurotunnel at Cheriton (19.3 miles, Calais 35 mins).

listing.description: A wonderful opportunity to Refurbish, Extend or Rebuild your very own “Forever House”.Grene Trest is a bungalow in a glorious setting but alas requires major refurbishment or demolition and rebuild (stp)Set in just over an acre it has protected fields on one side offering stunning countryside views from a very generous plot that is peppered with fruit trees being an old orchard.The plot measures roughly 188 x 24 meters (616 x 78 ft)The bungalow has been in the family for a long time. Full details can be found on the Mole Valley Local Authority Website under planning application number mo/2018/1509You could work with the existing structure or submit a planning application for a knock down and rebuild.It is possible you could offer a reduction in square footage and put in for planning for two smaller dwellings on the same footprint.The location is superb. Nestled in the greenbelt it's a stones throw from Leith Hill which makes up a large part of Surrey Hills' Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The immediate location overlooks neighbouring fields on a quiet country road.The country road has very quick access however to the A24. This main road will have you on the doorstep of Dorking or Horsham in around 10 minutes.The villages of Capel, Rusper & Newdigate are all very close by with award winning pubs and eateries putting these villages firmly on the local map.There are two golf courses less than 2 miles away (as the crow flies) Rusper and Gatton Manor.For detailed questions please email: Additional Information:Parking Arrangements: Garage & DriveVendors position: No ChainTenure: FreeholdServices: Mains Gas & Mains DrainageCounty Council: SurreyLocal Authority: Mole Valley

listing.description: The opportunityThe site is being offered by way of a conditional contract, subject to contract and planning.LocationThe approach to the development will be through Fen Street, leading into Fitzgerald Meadow, which has direct access onto Butchers Lane.The village of Boxford has a number of amenities including a primary school, church, two pubs, a post office and shop. The local towns of Sudbury, Ipswich and Colchester can all be accessed from the village in less than 40 minutes, all of which provide access to London by train.DescriptionThe site is an irregularly shaped parcel of land to the rear of the Houses at the end of Fitzgerald Meadow. It is bordered by houses to the south and south-west, and by mature trees to the north and north-east. Currently, the site comprises managed grassland but is not in cultivation or agricultural use.Site extends to approximately 1.36 acres (0.55ha).The site has appropriate rights over the land adjoining the site which provides access from the adopted highway. Details can be found within the Drop Box.PlanningThe site falls within Babergh District Council and it is believed that the site is outside of Boxford’s Settlement boundary, but borders it the south and west and is found within Boxford’s conservation area.The site is not in a flood zone, although the access to the site, Fen Drive, is in flood zone 3. Babergh have recently issued their updated Annual Monitoring Report for 2017-18, which states that after several years of under-delivery of housing the District is now able to demonstrate the required five year supply of housing land. Although the site is outside of Boxford’s settlement boundary and unallocated for housing development (and thus designated “countryside” for planning purposes), the site is well related to the village and could be considered a sustainable location.John Mason, a planner within Carter Jonas has carried out an initial planning appraisal, a copy of which is included within the Drop Box.Commercial terms• The owners are offering a conditional contract, initially for a period of 12 months with the right to extend for a further 12 months if a planning application or appeal decision remains outstanding.• The purchaser will be responsible for all costs involved in securing planning consent.• The planning application to be submitted in the joint names of the owner and the purchaser, to ensure the owner has step in rights if the purchasers withdraw.• All the surveys and reports commissioned by the purchasers to be in the joint names of the owners and the purchasers to ensure that they are available to the owners at no additional cost if the purchaser withdraws.• The developers to pay a contribution of £5000+VAT towards the owners agent fees, to be paid on conditional exchange of contracts.Additional informationA Drop Box for additional information has been created and access details are available from the agent.This information includes:• A planning appraisal prepared by Carter Jonas for the subject site.• Title Register• Title Plan• Bidding ProformaFurther informationShould you require any further information please contact either:Nick Muncey on alternatively, you can email; .OrCharles Harris on alternatively you can email; .

listing.description: An exciting opportunity to acquire one of three plots superbly situated behind the beach-side dunes of Camber Sands near Rye. Planning permission has been granted for a design by rx Architects to build a trio of contemporary three-bedroom houses, each with internal accommodation of approximately 1,600 sq ft, off-street parking and private gardens.Each plot is to be accessed from the street via a coastal-planted frontage, onto a surface of permeable paving with two parking spaces. The design proposes each unit to be partly single-storey and partly two-storey with stained timber cladding under flat roofs.At the front, a centrally positioned glazed door would lead into a covered timber pergola-style reception area also with a rear glazed door to a private garden area at the back of each house. On the western side, an entrance area would open into a single-storey element, with green sedum roof, providing an office / studio, utility room and a cloak room. The reception hallway would extend right into the main ground-floor living accommodation with an open-plan living room, dining and kitchen area. At the eastern end, a staircase would ascend to the upper level containing the three bedrooms, one with en-suite shower room, and a family bathroom. The master bedroom at the front would have sliding glazed doors opening onto an enclosed south-facing balcony, that would overhang or cantilever, and provide shading to the ground-floor area below. At the rear would be a raised deck on adjustable pads and at the eastern side of each garden area, a single storey building would provide for bicycle and other storage.Each site is offered completely cleared with drainage installed in preparation for immediate construction.The site is situated within rare proximity of Camber Sands, a stunning five-mile stretch of unspoilt sandy beach located in East Sussex, close to the border with Kent. It has one of the purest and longest dune systems on the South Coast, and the only one to be found in East Sussex. Camber sits on the edge of Romney Marsh, dubbed The Fifth Continent by 19th Century author Thomas Ingoldsby for its natural beauty, diverse habitats, extensive coastline and rich history. In the immediate area is the famous Rye Golf Club links course and Rye Harbour Nature reserve, which lies within a large triangle of land extending south from Rye, along the River Rother, past Rye Harbour to the sea, westward to Winchelsea Beach and northwards along the River Brede.Camber Sands and Greatstone are also considered to be among the best and most popular kite and windsurfing beaches on the south and east coasts.Within ten minutes’ walk is the excellent Gallivant, a well-regarded dune-side restaurant with bar, beach-huts and rooms. The historic town of Rye is approximately four miles away and has a wide range of local shops, pubs, restaurants. It can also be accessed via an off-road cycle route from Camber, taking around 20 minutes. The popular towns of Hastings and Tenterden are easily accessible.The station at Rye runs services to London St Pancras taking approximately one hour, and links to the continent, via the high-speed line through Ashford International.Please note:A Community Infrastructure Levy (cil) of £25,000 may be applicable. Please contact the office for more information.

listing.description: IntroductionPermitted development has been established for the conversion of this sizable Suffolk timber framed barn into two semi-detached dwellings.Each dwelling will measure around 2250-square feet and will include four double bedrooms, three first-floor bathrooms and substantial ground floor reception accommodation.The grounds measure around 0.6-acres and currently include five further outbuildings which would need to be cleared to create frontage and rear garden for each property. A sixth outbuilding could, subject to planning, be converted into detached cart lodges and/or ancillary accommodation to the principal dwellings.The groundsAs the name suggests Eyston Hall Farm sits in proximity to Eyston Hall, a substantial Grade Two listed, early 19th Century house. The hall, its neighbouring cottages and the barns all enjoy a peaceful environment and some breath-taking views thanks to their elevated location away from any major roads.Plot 1 will take advantage of some superb westerly views as well as exposure to the evening sun during the summer months.LocationThe barn is located between the villages of Borley and Belchamp Walter roughly four miles to the west of Long Melford and five miles north west of Sudbury. Colchester, Ipswich and Bury St Edmunds are all within 30-minute's drive.Points to noteA footpath runs through Eytson Hall Farmyard, although this is located outside the boundary of the proposed barns.A grain store to the north of the barns will be retained by our client for agricultural use.The permission can be viewed on Braintree District Council?S planning portal using the application number 17/02061/coupaPDF documents including existing plans, proposed plans and the decision notice are available by email upon request to .We understand the site is connected to mains electric and draws water from a bore hole. It has also been recently upgraded to fibre-optic broadband.The properties must be converted into dwellings by 9th November 2020.Before booking a viewing of any Bloomfield Grey instruction, we suggest that buyers view its full online details including the street-view representation, the site map, the satellite view and the floor plan. listing.description: A superb potential building plot that has lapsed planning permission to provide a spacious modern design detached family house of some 3,300sq.Ft, to include open plan living space, plus three further reception rooms, ground floor bedroom and en-suite, WC, utility room and plant room on the ground floor, whilst the first floor comprises five more double bedrooms, three with en-suites and a further family bathroom. All set in attractive gardens of approximately 0.9496 acres.Woodland House is a superb possible building plot that has lapsed planning permission to provide a spacious modern design of family house of some 3,300sq.Ft.The previous plans depict an open plan kitchen/dining/family space with large windows to the South over the garden, with a larder cupboard and plant room, an adjacent sitting room, further study/dining room, WC, open hallway with utility room and store. There was also due to be a further family room and a ground floor bedroom with an en-suite.The first floor was due to comprise five double bedrooms. The master bedroom has an en-suite bathroom and dressing room, two guest bedroom suites with n-suite shower rooms and two further double bedrooms and a family bathroom.Part of the design allowed for green seedum roofs, and doubtless further green technologies for further modern comforts, should one wish.The area that was designated for a detached double garage is no longer part of the plot.The majority of the garden being to the South and front of the property, in all believed to stretch to 0.9496 acres.The plot is located in the enviable location off Old Lane, just a few hundred meters from the 16th Century beauty of Mayfield High Street.Facilities in the village include a small supermarket, post office, butcher, baker, pharmacy, florist, greengrocers and deli as well as gp surgery, dentist and hairdressers. There are also a couple of cafes and Period Inns, including the renowned Middle House Hotel.There are pretty churches of various denominations, a flourishing primary school and the well regarded Mayfield School secondary school. For more comprehensive facilities Tunbridge Wells is 9 miles to the north. Railway stations can be found at Wadhurst (5 miles), Crowborough (6 miles), and Tunbridge Wells. These provide a fast and regular service to London Charing Cross, London Bridge and Canon Street. There is a regular bus service to Tunbridge Wells and Eastbourne.The area provides an excellent selection of both state and private schools. Nearby leisure facilities include tennis, bowls, numerous golf clubs, sailing on Bewl Water and at the coast. The area is criss-crossed with many beautiful walks through the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.Viewings are only by prior appointment.Planning Permission: The previous planning permission and further details can be found at  under planning ref: Wd/2013/2009/F

listing.short_description:
A detached barn with consent (subject to conditions) for conversion to three two bedroom bungalows with bathroom and open plan living/dining room/kitchen.

Biggin Hill

Set in a rural location yet accessible to the town with its range of shops, Waitrose and Tesco Express. There is a swimming pool and library and the Charles Darwin Academy is within half a mile. Bus services pass the property with connections to Orpington and Bromley both with stations to London

Planning

A delegated decision to grant planning consent was made by Bromley Borough Council on the 25th August 2016 for a change of use of the existing barn (B8 Storage) to Class C3 (Dwelling house) to form 3 x 2 bed units (56 day application for prior approval in respect of transport and highways, contamination, flood risk and noise under Class P, part 3 of the gpdo). Full details of the application and conditions on the consent can be inspected on the Bromley Town Planning web site - Application No: DC/16/02944/B8RES

Proposed Accommodation

The barn would be converted to form a terrace of three residential bungalows each with an open plan living/dining room/kitchen, an inner hall, two bedrooms and a bathroom. Each property would have a small front and back garden and adjoining land will be made available for parking.

Notes

1. Plans/drawings are for identification purposes only. 2. Our client owns adjoining land it may be possible to purchase additional areas. 3. The drive is jointly owned by Ruskin Meadows and Woodlands, an agreement as to future maintenance would need to be entered into. 4. A desk study and site investigation report has been prepared by Southern Testing Laboratories, a copy is available upon request. We are advised that this has been submitted to Bromley Council in order to dismiss some of the conditions of the planning consent. 5. There are area's of land occupied by tenants and situated off the drive, for areas in our clients ownership he is prepared to undertake to end the tenancies prior to a sale being exchanged and completed. 6. Interested buyers should make their own enquiries regarding services to the existing barn.

Route To View

From Biggin Hill proceed North on Main Road towards Biggin Hill London Airport and Bromley, shortly after passing the Black Horse Pub turn right into Jail Lane. Continue down Jail Lane passing Charles Darwin Academy of your left, the road then narrow and there will be a few properties on the right before a field, at the end of the field you will find Ruskin Meadows, The agent when making an appointment for you to view will give more detailed instructions regarding access

listing.description: Lot 2 - £350,000 (just the area highlighted red on the plan)A development opportunity which was allowed on appeal to convert a large agricultural building into two, three bedroom attached dwellings with domestic curtilage. All associated documentation can be found on the Maldon District planning portal: Allowed on appeal (Appeal Ref: App/X1545/W/18/3199978), the prior approval for the change of use of agricultural building to two dwellinghouses (Class C3), and for associatedoperational development in accordance with the terms of the application Ref coupa/mal/17/00977Rights of WayThe property is being sold subject to and with the benefit of all rights including rights of way, whether public or private, light, support, drainage, water and electricity supplies and other rights and obligations, easements and quasi-easements and restrictive covenants and all existing and proposed wayleaves, whether masts, pylons, stays, cables, drains, and gas and other pipes, whether referred to in these particulars or not.Little Acres takes full advantage of its views across open countryside. The village of Southminster has a post office, a doctor’s surgery, a large convenience store, restaurants and village public houses. The town of Burnham on Crouch lies to the south and offers a more comprehensive range of commercial, entertainment and shopping amenities. Southminster is well placed for many leisure pursuits available in the area including walking, bird watching and sailing amongst the river tributaries and marshes of Southminster. Belying its picturesque setting amongst rural countryside. Little Acres is well placed for transport amenities with Southminster station providing a regular service to London Liverpool Street with an average journey time of 71 minutes and lies only 1.2 miles away.additional- lot 1 & land;The grounds offer equestrian facilities and paddocks, surrounded by open countryside. Lot one has the main house with extensive front garden screened by mature trees and hedging, whilst to the rear is a further lawned area with swimming pool and garage. A long private driveway leads to both Little Acres and the barns.The whole site is circa 5.8 acres.
